Title: the romance recalibration

Scene: once you get the hang of it. Step. Step. Hop onto Ottoman.
Penny: What, what’s all this?
Oh, that is so thoughtful.
Yeah, i remember us driving up there, going to the winery and, that’s it.
Oh. Hey, what smells so good?
Pink wine and pizza bagels? It’s like eighth grade all over again. I am so lucky to have you.
Oh, you always know what not to say. I just, i can’t believe you did all this.
You did not just quote an Nsync song.
Oh.
I hadn’t really thought about it.
Hey, can I ask you a question? You’ve been married for a while, is it normal for the husband to kind of completely stop giving a crap?
Well, Leonard used to do all these things, like bring me flowers and wear pants.
Well, it’s not just the pants, it’s just, it’s like since we got married he doesn’t really try any more.
Hey.
Oh, it was fine.
Uh, chips.
Some wine.
Hm. At least he took an interest.
Nothing.
I don’t want to talk about it.
Fine. Lately I kind of feel like you’ve been taking me for granted.
It’s just, since we got married you seem to think you don’t have to try any more.
This is exactly why I didn’t want to talk about it.
Okay, you know what? Maybe I’ll take Amy with me to the spa this weekend instead.
All right, we’re heading out.
Thanks. Are you ready?
Let’s go.
When was the last time you got a massage?
Leonard stood on me once, too, but he was just trying to see the Rose Parade.
Well, yeah.
What are you doing here?
Okay. Leonard, I really appreciate that, but I need a little time to myself.
All right. Can you please just go and we’ll talk about this tomorrow?
I’m trying to figure it out.
Hey.
We’re not getting divorced.
Yeah. And there are a few things we need to stay on top of. So we thought it would useful, and I can’t believe I’m about to say this, um.
Although a rule about him texting me from in there might help with the romance.

Article 8, subsection B, Leonard will restrict videogaming in underpants to hours Penny is not home. This includes boxers, briefs, thongs, G-strings or anything else that calls attention to his pasty little thighs.
I think this all looks good.
Leonard: Well, it sounded like you were having a rough day, so i wanted you to come home to something nice.
Hey, do you remember when we went wine tasting in Santa Barbara and you said that was you’d ever had?
and this wine is why.
I made your favourite. Pizza bagels.
Well, now be careful, these are hot. i could explain the thermodynamics of why the cheese seems hotter than the crust, but instead I’m gonna keep it to myself.

Well, you know, It’s easy to take each other for granted and I never want to do that to you, because your love, it’s like a river. It’s peaceful and deep. Your soul is, it’s like a secret that I could never keep.
I quoted your favourite Nsync song.
Damn. I burped so hard, i died in my game.
Why?
That’s nice. I wear a size eight and a half.
Are you gonna laugh at the answer?
If you must know, Penny won a spa weekend from work, and she’s taking me.
So, hang out with me and we’ll have boys’ night.
Because we just spent our allowance on comic books.
Oh, no. Good game.
Hey.
Just ignore him.
What’s that supposed to mean?
Hey, what’s going on with you?
Well, hey, come on, just tell me.
What? Where is this coming from?
That is ridiculous.
No, no, no, no, let’s talk about it. I’m the one who’s made all the effort in this relationship since day one. Please tell me what more I could do?
Fine, go ahead.
Mm-hmm.
Have fun.
Go ahead, it’s fine.
Okay.
Thank you.
Thanks.
Earl grey?
Honey?
Unsweetened almond…
Sorry, thank you.
I really don’t know.
I don’t want to play a game, Sheldon.
Its not that I’d stopped trying, its just how relationships progress. They start with infatuation, but over time mellow into something more comfortable.
Is it about the failing state of my relationship with Penny?
I don’t want to wait two days for us to work this out.
I would pull this car over and kick you out, but If Penny dumps me, you’re all I got.
Hey.
I came here to apologize.
Okay. I don’t get it, you said make an effort, here I am making an effort.
I don’t understand what you want.
Hey.
Listen, we realized, that, uh, we’re facing some new challenges as a married couple.
Would you please help us make a relationship agreement? But one that’s tailored to us, okay, we don’t need a bathroom schedule.
What do you say?
Does it really need to say that?

Article 10, subsection C, if questioned Penny may not say that everything is fine if it isn’t. Other unacceptable responses include, it’s nothing, don’t worry about it, and, I said it’s nothing don’t worry about it.
Me, too.
Sheldon: Leonard, i’ve been meaning to ask you, what size shoe do you wear?
I’m trying to take more of an interest in other people’s lives.
That’s small. So, tell me, do you have any plans for the weekend?
Only if the answer is shopping for baby shoes.
Oh, well you know, that is interesting. I wonder what kind of infection you’ll come home with. My money’s on fungal. They’re still having girls night across the hall.
At our age, why don’t we call it man’s night?
If you do that, i’ll win in eight moves. I’ll win in five moves. I’ll win in one move.
Oh, Penny, I’m trying to take an interest in other people. Uh, how was your girls’ night?
Hmm. Did you have anything to eat?
Anything to drink?
Well, I’m just playing tennis against the drapes here.
Leonard, she might be drunk. All she had was chips.
Amy is free. She had a harp lesson on Saturday but it got cancelled. Boy, when you take an interest in people, you really uncork a geyser of nonsense.
And if they have any of those tiny bottles of shampoo?
You know what? I feel uncomfortable engaging in a public display of affection while their relationship is strained.
Bye.
Bye.
Yeah, I’ll miss you too.
Well, if x equals the amount that you’ll miss me, then I’ll miss you x plus one.
Here. You’re sad, so I made you tea.
And it’s just the way you like it.
Yes.
Yes.
Good Lord, I made you tea, just drink it.
Well, what can we do to cheer you up?
You want to play Jenga? Or, uh, Ticket to Ride? Hearthstone? What would you be the happiest losing at?
Wow, and I remember when you loved playing games with me. Maybe Penny isn’t the only relationship you’re phoning in.

Hmm. Yeah, you’re right. It’s like when I first encountered the Pythagorean theorem. You know, I was blown away that the square of the hypotenuse was the sum of the squares of the opposite sides. But now I’m just like, eh.
Would you like to play a driving game I invented?
Never mind. You know, Penny went to this spa to be away from you. Are you sure you should be going there?
Very well. You got married spur of the moment, I don’t see why your divorce should be any different.
Hello, Amy. It’s nice to see you.
And that’s how you make effort look effortless.
You know what? If you’d like, I could whip up a quick relationship agreement. Well, I’m at a spa, I might as well do something relaxing.
Very well. Hey, later we’ll check out the minibar, I’ll show you how Godzilla gets drunk.
There’s a cucumber in my water.
Do they know it’s there? I mean, should I tell somebody?
Interesting. The world’s most boring liquid and the world’s most boring vegetable, but you put ’em together and bleugh.
Oh good, you’re here. Are you still fighting? If you get divorced, do I get two Christmas’s?
I get to write a contract? I say, let’s get this party of the first part started.
If you find this draft acceptable, then I believe your new relationship agreement is ready to be signed.
I did this for free, let me get a little something.
Oh well, great then, here, you sign here, date here, and Penny, if you could initial here to indicate that you’re accepting Leonard in as is condition.
Mm. You seem to be forgetting the no nostalgia clause.
Amy: Penny, is it weird that we’re having girls’ night here, but you don’t live here any more, so it’s basically my girls’ night?
But now you’re thinking about it and it bothers you? I get that.
Better than ever. He asks about my day, takes an interest in my life. He’s like my boyfriend in college, except he’s real, so people can see him.
Well Sheldon always has his pants on. I don’t think I could pick his knees out of a line-up.
Uh, Penny, I don’t know how to say this, but this is my first girls’ night and you’re kind of bumming everybody out.
I’ll call you when we get to the hotel.
I will bring them home so you can show me how Godzilla takes a shower.
Uh-huh. Bye, Sheldon.
Bye.
Bye.
I’ll miss you.
I’ll miss you more.
If you miss me x plus one, I’ll miss you open paren x plus one, close paren to the second…
Sheldon walked on my back two weeks ago, but that was just ’cause there was a spider on his pillow and he was trying to get away.
I don’t know the protocol, are you gonna be naked for your massage?
Hmm. Then this is probably too many clothes.
Nice to see you, too.
Sheldon, why don’t we give them some privacy?
Uh-huh.
It’s there on purpose. It’s refreshing.
It’s in our agreement. I have to laugh.
I remember signing our first relationship agreement.
Right, right. Got it.
Bernadette: Things going well with you and Sheldon living together?
I’ve been seeing him for years, I’m still not convinced he’s real.
It’s okay, Howie never has on pants. The Domino’s guy brings the pizza like this now.
I have one. What if you got a giant slingshot and flung yourself into the wall?
You actually expect me to do this while holding a baby in the dark.
Howard: All right, got Halley to sleep.
Yeah, got to get her hooked on TV or someday she’ll want me to play outside. Boy, that floor is so squeaky. I’m surprised I didn’t wake her up walking out of the room.
Well, i put the rug down. It didn’t help.
Did try nailing a couple of the boards down.
Yeah, it left little holes in the floor, that’s why I bought the rug.
MIT’s motto is mind and hand, which just so happens was also my motto as a lonely teenager.
Is that supposed to be funny?
Okay, this grid represents the room. All we need to do is plot out where each squeak is, and we can find a quiet path to the crib.
Mm. Except the creature in the crib is a level-nine poop monster.
Okay, space A3, here we go. It’s squeaking. Mark it.
Mm. I hope she has the same amount of sex in it I did. None. Next square.
It’s a tradition of my people. (Singing) If I were a rich man, ya ba dibba dibba dibba dibba dibba dibba dum.
So, what we did was map out the entire room to identify every squeak. Watch. It’s easy,
Then simply sit, spin, stand, stretch, maybe in looser pants, then step, grab, tiny pivot, pull, and you’re there. Easy peasy, mac and… you get the idea.
Bigger problems, I felt something pop.
Raj: Yeah, i heard you on the baby monitor. Didn’t think you could think you could turn the theme from Walking Dead into a lullaby.
Have you tried anything to fix it?
I know. Blue shag, what were you thinking?
Hang on. No offence to her father, but he’s not an MIT trained engineer. Thinking and building is what you do.
Oh come on, we just need to be more creative. What if you didn’t step on the floor at all? Like, what if you swung on a rope from the ceiling?
Okay, um, okay, what if you rig up a pulley system and move yourself across the room in a harness?
It looks like a map from Dungeons and Dragons.
Okay, uh, you check for squeaks, and I will mark them down.
It’s nice to think that you grew up in this room and now your daughter’s going to as well.
Why do you bounce with your hands in the air like that?
Material Girl needs ot be retired, that is your karaoke song.
Don’t do that in socks, I almost broke my neck.
Hold on, I don’t think she was impressed.
Bernadette (on phone): Okay. Thanks, daddy. He said the only way to really fix an old floor like that is to tear it up and replace the whole thing.
Penny (after Amy laughs): Do you really think that’s funny?
